intro: Aria mougeotii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has finely divided, trifoliate leaves. It produces small, hairy fruits that contain several seeds. Aria mougeotii is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in the undergrowth.
